Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Nikon P300 Review: Overview
Integrating seamlessly into Nikon's upper echelon of digital compact cameras, the new Coolpix P300 boasts some serious assets that advanced photography enthusiasts are likely to covet.
For starters, the Nikon P300 claims a 12.2-megapixel, back-illuminated CMOS image sensor supported by the brand's EXPEED C2 processor, together making quite an attractive combination for those interested in pursuing captures at higher sensitivities.
Increasing intrigue is the addition of the impressively fast f/1.8, 24mm wideangle, 4.2x optical zoom lens with Nikon's High Refractive lndex glass.
The £300 compact sits just beneath its launch stable mate the Coolpix P500; an advanced bridge that replaces the once popular P100, and is likely to be square ... ly aimed at photographers' thirsting for more manual control as well as a higher quality of image capture.
As a high-entry compact we are not surprised but still pleased to note the inclusion of full manual controls offering four exposure modes: Programmed Auto (P), Shutter-priority (S), Aperture-priority (A) and Manual (M). But we are disappointed to find no ability to capture images in raw format, as arguably many of its target consumers would require.
Following the trend for HD movie capture, the Nikon P300 provides access to Full HD – 1080p – movie recording with stereo sound, and unlike some of its rivals the new Nikon compact camera benefits from optical zoom and autofocus during recording, allows photographers to fire stills whilst filming and records footage in slow or fast motion using recording speeds of up to 120fps (VGA). expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
With just a few trade-offs, the Nikon Coolpix P300 is as close as a rival gets to the Canon PowerShot S95 in the realm of compact cameras with manual controls. Both cameras distinguish themselves from the pack by targeting discerning photographers looking for a pocketable complement to a DSLR - one that doesn't sacrifice much in terms of performance or features.
The Nikon Coolpix P300 is geared more toward the casual-photographer side of that user base, and it costs around £70 less than the Canon PowerShot S95. It differs from the S95 in several ways, as it has no RAW shooting, no manual focus, a less-sturdy body, and no function ring like the one around the S95's lens. Despite all that, however, the Coolpix P300 outclasses its main competitor in some key areas, offering an F1.8 len ... s that excels in low light, a much faster burst mode, better battery life, sharper images, and nice in-camera editing tools.
Head to head, the PowerShot S95 scored a bit higher in our performance tests. For the price, however, the Nikon Coolpix P300 is an outstanding option, and it just might be a better buy for casual shooters who don't care about RAW mode or manual focus.
Nikon Coolpix P300: Hardware and Design
The marquee feature in the 12-megapixel Nikon Coolpix P300 is its F1.8 lens, which is the widest aperture available in this camera's price range. The only point-and-shoot cameras we've seen with lenses that rival that fast lens are the Olympus XZ-1 and the Samsung TL500, both of which are significantly larger in size and cost far more money. The P300's optically stabilized 4.2X zoom lens reaches from an ultrawide-angle 24mm to 100mm telephoto; nothing huge, but it's well equipped for both sprawling vistas and intimate portraits.
The Nikon Coolpix P300 has a boxy, classic-looking build, with a body that measures 103x32x58mm. While it is lightweight, the camera feels a bit hollow, as its metal-plated frame is plastic on the inside. Instead of a full-on handgrip, the P300 has a raised lip on its right front face and a textured, rubberized thumbgrip on its back.
You work with all of the controls via physical buttons and dials on the top and back of the camera. A mode dial on the top lets you select from full manual, aperture-priority, shutter-priority, Auto, program Auto, the scene mode menu, backlight-correction mode, and a handheld low-light mode. To the right of that dial is a slightly finicky on/off switch (typically you need to press it firmly or more than once for the camera to turn on), the shutter/zoom control, and an unmarked dial that lets you manually adjust shutter speeds and program Auto settings.
On the back are a dedicated video-record button, a playback button, a combination directional-pad/scrollwheel for menu navigation and manual settings, a menu button, and a delete button. In manual mode and aperture-priority mode, the scrollwheel controls aperture adjustments, and pressing the scrollwheel's top, left, right, and bottom edges doubles as one-touch access to flash controls, the self-timer, exposure compensation, and macro mode, respectively.
The Nikon Coolpix P300 also offers a pop-up flash, which you flip up and down with a physical switch on the left side of the camera; in manual and program modes, you can set the intensity of the flash in 0.3 EV increments. The camera's HDMI-out port resides under a door on the left side, and the camera's A/V-out port, battery, and SD Card slot are tucked under a locking door on the bottom.
As we've come to appreciate on Nikon's other recent Coolpix cameras, menu navigation is straightforward. The menu text is clear and sharp on the P300's 3-inch-diagonal LCD screen, and manual controls are well labeled with icons that tell you which physical controls you should use to adjust them.
See also: Group test: what's the best compact camera?
Nikon Coolpix P300: Shooting Modes and Features
In addition to those full manual controls over its F1.8 lens and shutter speeds, the Nikon Coolpix P300 offers an array of specialized scene modes, creative filters, and editing tools... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I got this camera to shoot my wife, kid and dogs, and a little travel stuff so I don't always have to get my big camera out.. Only had it for about a week but I'm really happy with it so far. The image quality is very, very good for a little point and shoot. I have another point and shoot that's about 2 years old and a little cheaper and the image quality is poor - hence, I bought this one. I really like that in manual mode you can actually select your aperture and shutter speed. My other one has what it calls a manual mode but it doesn't allow you to select both settings.. The 24mm wide angle lens is great too. The video I've done so far is very good. Great size and feel too. There's no RAW option, but I've got my SLR for that so it's fine for me. I don't want to spend a lot of time ed ... iting the stuff I shoot with it anyway - I edit enough with my professional work.. Overall it's a great little camera for the money. I don't need it to handle like my SLR in terms of performance - I just wanted (and got) a simple camera that my wife can use too, and that's small and takes very good pictures for the money. The true test will be in a year or two - hopefully it's still kicking... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I am an artist and I use photography as a basis for many of my paintings. I was looking for a good camera with manual and automatic features, that could also be good for taking reproductions of my work and also for enjoying on a daily basis and while travelling. I have been using a heavier DSLR for years and suddenly a photographer friend recommended this very light-weight gem! It has an large screen. Great and an abundance of features. Is self explanitary, easy to use and figure out (besides the software manual etc) The manual features provide professional quality pictures. The close-up, pet, and sports features are fantastic. The video is great including the sound. The one fault I found was that the digital night photo is off tone but I think I can work on figuring that out with the man ... ual settings. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I am incredibly happy with this camera! It is a nice size and easy to use. I take a lot of pictures in a variety of ways and have found this camera to be what I hoped for. I have tried zoom then crop the zoom, photographing while in motion, close-ups, indoor, outdoor, landscape, sunsets... I am especially happy with the clarity of the zoomed pictures, even while in motion. It is very simple to crop pictures from the original. Using the video feature is great, as all you do is press the record button, no need to change settings. Then when done, it returns to photo mode. The stereo sound is nice. The flash is manual and I'm not sure how I like that, though the camera does let you know when you need it. Night landscape and back lighting are settings that are right on the dial and ea ... sy to change to. I love that! The clarity using the sports setting are not as clear as I like and it takes the pictures very quickly, then shows them, so you can't take sets right after one another, there is some delay there. The Display is large and clear. The Fisheye feature is fun. The battery last a fair amount of time, but takes a while to charge. I have not tried the manual settings. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Nifty camera for low light, BUT... - Smallest flash in the history of photography? - Flash overexposes inside six feet. Difficult fill flash. - Camera will fire in low light before AF or exposure is set! - Left to its own devices, camera defaults to high ISO outdoors...should go to lower, high quality ISO when light sufficient. - No external charger for spare battery. - Video recording beyond 5 min. heats camera. - Lens flare polluted with colors. - Shutter lag embarrassing for high-end P&S. - CD owner's manual no good in the field. Cheapsters at Nikon should at least offer printed manual at profitable extra charge. However... - SLR-like controls are great for serious photographer, beginner or SLR hopeful. - Lens sharpest at f/5.6, per tests. - Excellent screen, better than my Nikon ... SLR. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: A DLSR in a point and shoot body
Item.Review:
Pros: DLSR features in a point and shoot body
Cons: Not sure yet about the battery life. I bought an extra.
I love this camera. It wasnt in the store, but Best Buy ordered it for me. As I was reading on the website the specs, I couldnt believe this was in a point and shoot body. It has a 24 mm wide lens, manual, shutter priority, aperture priority, program, scene selection, and point and shoot. The flash pops up from the top of the camera when YOU want it up, but with the lens, ready.. 1.8 at the wideangle setting, it takes great natural lites. 12 Million megapixels, great screen (920.000 dots), macro up to 1.2 inches. Image stabilization, bracketing, exposure compensation, Video is 1080P, the list goes on and on. Im just now seeing this camera in the photo magazines. Best Bu ... y should have one on the floor. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Chose over Pansonic LX5 and Canon S95
Item.Review: My reasoning and after reading all the reviews. Point and Shoot cameras to me are cameras that will fit in my pocket. So this eliminates the LX5. My friend owns the Leica version and I was just going to pick it up to tease him on paying $200 more than me just because of the red Leica badge. But this camera is just to big. I've looked at the Canon S95 for over a year but the body is just not for me. It's slippery and I can't get a grip on it. The size of it is perfect though. Here's what it came down to. Pros for me: on Nikon P300. The fast lense 1.8. Takes the best shots I've seen in low light situations. The full HD 1080 since I do lots of youtube videos and with stereo sound. Combined with being still light and small. Cons for me: Flash will not fire on HD video. My Motorola At ... rix flash works when using the HD video. Camera will not work while plugged in charging. But that's okay I found 2 OEM batteries and OEM portable charger online for $16.99 Overall for $100 less that the Canon S95 it's a no brainer unless you shoot in RAW. The camera may feel like it's not solid since it is so light but it is. The screen is so bright and detailed as well. The battry life is also amazing and I probably won't need the other 2 batteries but for backup only. 4.5/5 stars for me. You can't have everything. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Great point & shoot, wish it has 16:9
Item.Review: The P-300 starts up fast, works great especially in low light situations for a point & shoot. Outdoor day light shooting is also superb. The color is vivid and vibrant. The color tone on skin is a bit cold compares to my Canon SLR, then again it's not a fair comparison because of the huge price gap. I have only one complain, the P-300 cannot do 16:9 ratio in lower resolution setting, it's only available on 9M setting, which is too large for email transmission if you want to send multiple pictures. I love shooting outdoor scenery in 16:9 because the pics fill up a computer screen perfectly with better panoramic effect. I hope Nikon will offer firmware updates later to allow 16:9 on lower settings. Flkid

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy to use, Fast lens at wide, Good color
Cons: Lacking some key features. Not so great build
I want to start by saying that im a nikon fanboy. I LOVE my D7000. I am very disappointed with the P300 overall... but first ill start with that i liked about the camera.
PROS: -Compact Design -Easy to use (especially if you have used nikons before) -Above average picture quality for small image sensor. - Fun slow-mo video( but in standard definition) -full 1080P video -Fast F1.8 lens (only on wide end 24mm) -Wide angle lens for a P&S -Fairly quick focus. -great color rendition (my favorite thing about nikons)
CONS -Does not shoot RAW files (does not bother me completely cuz i dont look for it in P&S cameras) -NO SPOT METE ... RING! WTH... -At full tele the aperture is at F4.9 -The build is not solid -The nose reduction is too aggressive even at low ISO. Sacrifices sharpness -Cannot customize amount of noise reduction -Must charge battery within the camera.
There are my pros and cons. it is a good camera but could have been much better. Keep in mind this is Nikon's fist attempt in the enthusiast point and shoot category. Hopefully the follow up of the P300 will be better. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Great features, fantastic photos, easy to use, color is pheonomial. Low light and backlit subjects photograph perfectly. HD video is outstanding for a small camera. I'm very pleased. Take the time to print out the manual and find out about all of the possibilities with this baby. My only issue, but not really an issue, is that it's a little small for large hands, but I guess all compact cameras are these days.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Bought this to carry along so I don't miss shots when I'm not lugging around my DSLR. I've read several reviews saying this is not an enthusiast P&S as it does not shoot RAW. I would think most people looking to purchase this camera want something for those days they left the DSLR at home (i.e. not planning to shoot RAW anyway). I carry this backpacking (on multi-day trips when weight is an issue), I carry it at work for quick random shots, and I have it in the car just in case. If I plan to shoot RAW, that's just it: I PLAN to shoot RAW. If I'm going to bother shooting RAW, I'll use my DSLR - that's why I have it. I bought this to be a P&S that I could simply use to take a picture when planning isn't possible and this camera truly delivers. Shots are colorful, sharp and well expos ... ed. Low light photography (don't care for on-camera flash) is exceptional. Gives you Aperture and Shutter Priority modes, full Manual and Programed Auto along with full Auto (which I never use), exposure compensation, and color saturation and hue adjustment options just to name a few. Some of the scene modes are actually kind of useful and I find myself using them at times when I'm rushed and have to fire a shot quickly or miss it. Showed some photos I took indoors with no flash to several photography enthusiasts (Nikon, Canon and Sony DSLR users) and their response was WOW, you took those pictures with THAT?!? The f1.8 lens (beating out all the competition in this price range) is far more valuable then shooting RAW (in my opinion). If shooting RAW is what keeps you from buying this camera, you're missing the point. This isn't meant to replace a DSLR, it's a camera for those of us who own one but can't carry it everywhere and can't stand not having artistic control when photographing (so a regular P&S just won't cut it for us). Learn to get the exposure you want in-camera (or at least close to it) and you won't worry about shooting jpeg from a Point & Shoot. Keep in mind that despite how much I LOVE this camera it IS a point and shoot. Don't try to compare it to a DSLR as I keep seeing in other reviews. It just isn't that. But it is the best P&S I've owned or used and don't regret choosing this for an instant! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Great P&S camera with advanced features
Item.Review: I bought the P300 to replace my Nikon D60 which was just too big to haul around when I was out with my two kids. The reasons why I bought the P300 are: * Bright lens - This little camera takes wide angle pictures without the flash indoors (f/1.8) * Manual controls - Need that for the fine tuning. This camera has two dial controls so in M mode it is easy to change aperture and shutter values. * Manual flash - I rather have to popup the flash myself than dig thru the menus to disable it when not needed. * Small size - P300 is kinda boxy but easy to carry around. Why I went with the P300 and not the P310? When I compared the features, I have decided that I do not need what the P310 offers so P300 saved me some money. One negative aspect of the camera is that there is no way to adjust th ... e JPEG compression. Indeed like some other reviews stated, the compression is visible. But that's just minor as most of my pictures are either viewed on the TV or printed in 4x6 format. Compression does not really show in such cases. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I shoot with a Nikon D300s, as well as old film cameras and this is a great addition to my collection. I bought this for those daily moments where a DSLR is not needed. It takes great quality photos and is nice and compact, easily fits in my pocket. If you are looking for a good low light p&s this is a great choice. The PASM settings are rare on a point and shoot and were a must for me. I haven't used the movie setting much, but they on camera record button does make it tempting, and so very easy.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Great value for a great price
Item.Review: I'm a promateur photographer and was looking for a camera that I could carry all the time with me. I have a medium format camera a DSLR but these are not the kind that I could carry in my pocket. I've spent about a month to compare cameras of this (P300) range. Looked at the most obvious one the, S95, but the battery life, barely 200 shots, was a break for me, not even mentioning the $100 price difference. Looked at the GF2 as well but after playing with it in the store and seeing the actual size different and the price different I was turning my attention back to the P300. I've spent a week reading reviews about the P300 that it has a smaller sensor, it doesn't shoot RAW etc, etc, than came a price break here at B&H which finally led me to the store the very next day and I've purchas ... ed the camera. That was 2 weeks ago and since day 1 I'm telling myself that it was totally futile to to spend a month searching for something else. This camera does the job. Small enough that it can fit into your shirt pocket, have a %50 longer battery life than the S95. Image quality is great for a point and shoot camera and the fast lens, F1.8, is making it a great low light camera. The screen on the back is just amazing to review photos. The different shooting modes makes this camera versatile for almost any occasion but my favorite is the panorama mode which can help anyone, even without any experience, to shoot perfect seamless panoramas. If you are wondering case wise and looking for something small but rugged I can recommend the Santiago 20 Camera Pouch (Black) by Lowepro, which going to house your camera. A bit on the tight side so don't expect anything else to fit in but rugged enough so I can just toss my camera in my back pack and don't have to worry about it. Highly recommend this camera! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Fast/accurate auto-focus; Good Image Quality; Easy To Use; Good in Low Light; Short Lag Time; Large Clear LCD; Small / Compact; Good Image Stabilization
I own -and have owned- a number of compact digital cameras. Actually, it's pretty hard to find a really "bad" one nowadays ..but I'm absolutely delighted with my new Nikon Coolpix P300! Very compact, very versatile w/manual control if you like, and very easy to get great pictures in any mode! Good video capability too. The big, clear LCD viewfinder is outstanding! It has certainly become one of my favorites and would highly recommend it! The package I got from Beach Camera included a spare battery ..a nice thing to have.. and another thing about this camera I like is it seems to have excellent battery longevity.I actually kept ... wondering when it was going to run down ..you seem to get a lot of "mileage" before it runs down, but it's always a good idea to carry along a charged spare battery. Battery life does seem conspicuously longer than many compacts I've used. All things considered, it's one of the most delightful compact cameras I've owned! expand » « collapse

Item.Review:
Pros: Good Image Stabilization; Fast/accurate auto-focus; Large Clear LCD; Easy To Use; Small / Compact; Good Image Quality
Cons: No Viewfinder
Casual user. Best feature is ease of use. Easy to follow menu system.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I was looking for a camera that would keep up with the speed of a toddler. My larger digital camera was just not able to take the quick shots I needed for such an active subject. With the Coolpix P300 I am able to get great, fast shots. The settings and special features have been fun to use as well. The in-the-camera cropping is really neat. You just zoom in, press one button and you have a cropped version that you are prompted to save as a separate photo. I have gotten some great b/w close up shots. The fast start up is wonderful. Prints from the photos are sharp and true to color. I am very pleased with my purchase. I purchased an additional battery and external charger. I will be purchasing another battery soon for an extra backup for extended use when I travel.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Finally, after a long time the fastest and the best in low light point and shoot pocket cameras has arrived. The new Nikon S9100 is a 3.5 lens with a 9.5 fps burst rate at full 12.1 megapixels resolution also had 18X zoom with the best one solution lens on it. The new Nikon P300 is a 1.8 lens with an 8 fps burst rate at full 12.2 megapixels resolution with a very good portrait lens on it. Both of this new pocket point and shoots are both from Nikon and much, much better than G9, G10, G11, and G12 point and shoot series from Canon. For a long time Canon has been the best when it becomes to pocket point and shoot cameras but with the April 2011 arrivals of this 2 Nikon cameras, Canon is now left in the dust. I highly recommend this 2 powerful new pocket point and shoot cameras from Nikon ... to anyone who likes to travel and wants to produce DSLR quality photos but don't want to carry big and heavy DSLR cameras. This new Nikons are both small but amazingly fast and easy to use for a pocket point and shoot camera. Both of these cameras are on sale for only [$] dollars considering its many capabilities this price is reasonable. The Nikon S9100 had 3 cool colors of silver, black, and pinkish-red while Nikon P300 is available only in black. I have researched both of cameras carefully and was also amazed with the previous versions of it the Nikon S8100 and Nikon P200. That's why, I highly recommend these 2 cameras; 1 for portrait photography ??? Nikon P300 and the other one is an overall one solution lens ??? Nikon S9100. Both cameras are fast and very good in low light. It's like a mini DSLR without the heavy weight and yes it's a first and a dream come true for this incredible pocket cameras. That is why I highly recommend both Nikon S9100 and Nikon P300. It blows away all other competitors including top of the line of Kodak, Sony, Panasonic, or even Canon is no match compare with these New Nikons. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I carry the camera in my pocket at all times - even when walking the dog ! Performs extraordinarily well.... focuses fast & accurately.... second shot delay almost non-existent.... love the low light capability & the extra wide angle lens. I also like the simplicity of the controls... fast & plain. Love the easy delete features. It outperforms my comparable Canon & Fuji cameras with ease. A total slam dunk for those that like to use manual controls, however, the auto capability is superlative ! Don't like the lack of a viewfinder, but that seems to be the way things are going now-a-days. And, If I had my rathers, I would opt for AA power, but the supplied battery has been performing perfectly. I am very happy that I chose this product & would recommend it without rese ... rvations. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Great camera at a great price
Item.Review: Compact size. Easy intuitive controls for manual shooting. 1080p video a plus. One button video recording great, no need to switch to video mode before recording. 12 MP sensor. Picture quality good.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Great indoor/social cam for a dSLR user
Item.Review: I got this for its bright lens and full manual controls. I took it on the Seattle Underground tour, and it produced some fine images in really low light. It has dedicated wheels for both shutter and aperture, one of which also serves as a rotary four way controller, which I prefer to the arrow style. Great detail/low noise for such a small sensor. Really wish the lens stopped down to f22, or at least more than f8. Fairly traditional CoolPix menuing scheme - I'm used to it so not much to learn. Full HD video a nice feature, although not as good as a camcorder.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Great little pocket camera. Takes beautiful pictures and the HD video is stunning! All controls are easy and intuitive and the display is fantastic! This is the first point and shoot that I've owned that lets me set apertures and shutter speeds manually which is groundbreaking.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Great pictures, lots of features & fits in pocket
Item.Review: I did a lot of research for a small camera with lots of features and good picture quality, which I could take to any event or for that unexpected "Kodak moment", when my full size digital Canon EOS 40D was just too big to have with me. This camera has exceeded my expectations for an easy to use point-&-shoot camera. The 24 mm wide-angle 1.8 lens captures sharp images in very low light, besides having a 4x zoom-in when needed. The manual controls give you lots of options for any picture scene, including fast action grandkids. The HD movie feature is also fun to have with you for those action scenes with sound opportunities. The pop-up-flash stays locked out of the way until you really need it. I also find the macro setting down to 1.2 inches very handy, for example, when doing genealogy ... research and need a quick picture of a research book page, instead of making notes or copy machine fees. A very powerful camera for high quality pictures. I always have it with me on-the-go everyday. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: The lens is sharp and clear. The menus are quick and easy to navigate for a large array of special settings. The brilliant movies are at your fingertips, but there is a slight delay after the button is pushed. The zoom works very smoothly on movies and photos.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: This is a great general point and shoot with great image quality at a fair price. I wish it shot in RAW format but short of that it is a great little camera. easy to use, lots of simple modes to choose from, rechargeable interchangeable battery, compact, well designed.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Bought this camera to replace another broken Sony wsc55 p&s. Wow, this has surpassed my expectations for p&s cameras in general. Picture quality is super,speed is super,shutter lag..the best I've ever had,(including canon G11),size is right,battery life is pretty good. This is used for family outings and events. Nothing to complain about for me. Highly recommend for the price..good bang for the buck.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: What a nice little camera! I know it isn't the smallest one but, therefore, it's good to handle. I keep it always with me, no problem (small enough), and it is always quick and ready to shoot and has a lot of useful options. Although I have no previous experience with NIKON, the menu speaks for itself! Panorama (swipe), film, automatic and manual (!) settings. The photo's come out very clearly and are razor sharp and the colors are bright as if a polorizing filter is used. Although I am pleased with the range of the lens, especially the nice wide angle (!) I would have preferred a bigger zoom. But, even in poorly lit circumstances the results are satisfying. I also have a Olympus e-510 but find myself more and more using the NIKON P300. It's just so easy to use and the results can compete ... with any SLR camera! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I used to have Canon S95 before then sold it. Now I try Nikon P300 and feel like compact film camera due to the retro design top dial function. The pictures quality is as good as Canon S95 when I print 4X6 And the price lower than Canon S95. Now it's just everyday camera.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: My wife and I both have Nikon DSLR cameras, but don't want to or can't carry them with us everywhere we want to shoot. One of the biggest things this camera has going for it is the f1.8 aperture, which is great in low light. The ability to shoot in different modes such as shutter speed priority, aperture priority, etc is also a big plus. The only drawback for me is that it won't shoot in RAW format. It's JPEG only. Not a huge deal, but that would be nice. I ultimately decided that having a more portable camera is worth the trade off of not being able to shoot RAW. That's what our DSLR's are for anyway. The video is great. The SD card gives you the capability to really extend video time. At 1080 res, it takes a lot of memory. The P300 is a great portable, high-end point and ... shoot with a lot of DSLR features. It works very well for my needs. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Use: - take pictures of the family, pet, social events +'s - Excellent low-light performance for indoor shots - Manual controls - Good video performance. Dedicated video button is great! - Ok, zoom but you get a wide-angle zoom all thru the range - Super fast lens gives consistently amazing picture quality -'s - no external battery charger. you have to charge the battery while it is in the camera. Might not be a big deal for you but is for me. I looked at/used the S9100, Canon S90, Panasonic LX-5 and finally chose this camera. Best overall performer, excellent picture quality and if you want manual control over just about anything - all in a compact form factor!

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Compact, light and easy to use out of the box. It can be as simple as a point and shoot needs to be for quick shots or it has the ability to be manipulated to custom any setting you want. The video feature is awesome and it has great sound quality as well. I very nice camera that is very versatile when I don't want to lug around the DSLR and still get great images.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Not bad, but not great either
Item.Review: A little disappointed with the image quality. I owned a Canon S90, and chose to go with the P300 for its Easy Panorama, HDR, manual mode, f1.8 lens, and 1080p video. Video is great, but I bought this camera more for the stills. Easy Panorama shows artifacts every time - I see a fuzzy vertical stripe down the center of the final image. I don't know if this is a software bug or what. HDR is decent, but I've seen better HDR out of the iPhone 4 camera. Startup time is slow compared to S90. S90 image quality is better.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Comfortable Controls; Easy To Use; Great Picture Quality; Bright LCD; Easy Setup
A graduation gift for grandson. He began using it the night before graduation and loved it. B&H suggested adding 4 Gb Memory Card and it was great idea. Pictures are wonderful, clear, and sharp. A really outstanding, simple point & shoot with programable features for those that want to do more.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Versatile features, Nice quality, Great price
I just received this camera 2 days ago and I like what I see so far. I'm very use to the controls my D200 and D300 so point and shoots never really appeal to me mainly due to complicated menus and controls. I was able to find every single thing that I need and want to use within 30 minutes without looking at the manual. I am VERY specific about what I want in a camera and try to come as close as possible to my DSLR's features while being reasonable in price especially since I use it mainly to get snap shots of possible locations to shoot clients. I love the macro and F1.8 along with being able to manually chose my focusing points which was a must have feature for me. But like I said, Great so far.........Also I bought it for $269, ... saw it dropped to $245 and BB credited my account for the difference within 1 day, very cool. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: This is really a great camera. I previously had a Sony point and shoot and a Panasonic Lunix. This is by far a vast improvement over both. The camera is very small and lightweight. It fits easily into my pockets. Most important to me, it takes very fast photos. I must add, though, that the person in the photos must be still for the quick second when the picture is being taken or else the picture will be blurry--the reason I gave the camera four rather than five stars. However, the camera quickly allows the photographer to take another subsequent photo, thus decreasing the chance that all photos will be blurry. This camera is also good in dark situations. I tend to take inside photos and am very impressed by the pictures the camera takes in sub-optimal light. The zoom and other features ... of the camera have been adequate for my everyday needs. A professional or serious photographer might want a camera with more options, but for an amateur picture taker, this camera should suit everyday needs. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I purchased this camera for my wife to replace an aging Kodak point and shoot. It setting it up prior to wrapping up as a Christmas present, I did some test shots. The speed on this camera with a Class 10 SDHC card is amazing. I think it's quicker than my Nikon D60. The pictures looked remarkably clear in my test shots. The video mode is easy to use and the slow motion is a nifty bonus. I think she's going to be really happy with it coming from a 3 year old 8mp CCD Kodak to this guy. I can't comment on any cons as she hasn't used it yet. If possible, I'll update this post down the road to include some feedback.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: DSLR Quality in a Point-and-shoot Packag
Item.Review: Wnen I decided to get a new point-and-shoot camera, I knew I wanted something that could deal with low-light situations, and I wanted high-res images that would be good source material for me to manipulate in Photoshop. I started by asking people I knew who took photography seriously. This narrowed my field of choices down to the Canon Powershot and the Nikon Coolpix. I looked at all the reviews and comparisons i could find and decided on either the Coolpix P300 or the S9100. I was seduced by the extreme zoom available with the S9100, but what convinced me in the end was the superior optics of the P300. Just one day after buying he P300, I knew I made the right choice! In a low-light situation, in Auto mode, with no flash and no tripod and taking all of 2 seconds to compose I snapped a sho ... t that turned out amazing. The LCD is great for my old eyes, and the menu is very intuitive. Yes I wish there was greater zoom, but since I pull almost everything into Photoshop anyway, having better image quality is more important. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I'm a canon dslr user, and needed a point and shoot for my upcoming travels. I had an old canon point and shoot, and thought that I'd be going the canon route for this, but was extremely disappointed with the quality of the images from the canon s95 (at the time the canon s100 was just released but not readily available so i didn't get to try it out.) I also tried the sony hx9v. i was blown away by the video quality but was really disappointed with the image quality. i really wanted a camera with a low aperture, and was pleasantly surprised with what came out of the p300. in comparison tests, all of the pictures were better than the canon s95. so far so happy with my purchase.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I bought this to have in my purse when I don't feel like carrying my big girl camera (a d5100). It's probably not pocket sized, but definitely small enough to just keep in my purse. I like that it does not have too much shutter lag (something that really annoyed me in my old point and shoot). It turns on and is ready to go quickly. I haven't even used the flash, since the camera is great with low light even without it. The one awkward thing about it is that the power button is so tiny it usually takes me two tries to turn the thing on. But other than that, it's great.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I have a Nikon D7000 but wanted a lighter and smaller point-and-shoot camera for everyday use. WOW! This P300 is an amazing little thing. Someone else here said that it is a DSLR quality in a small package and he is absolutely correct. And the 1080p video with stereo sound is stunningly good too! I Love this little thing, and so does everyone else who I show it to. Great product indeed!

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: This is a great camera and is similar to the s95, but because of the smaller sensor it should not be compared. This is an amazing small sensor camera. It has a fast lens and a very detailed LCD. Takes good lowlight camera and the video is good for a P&S.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: This small digital camera is packed full of high quality features with lots of manual control. I actually got interested in it because Consumer Reports gave it their highest marks for cameras in this class. Battery last a real long time. You can adjust the picture to show in many different colors,hues, contrasts, etc. One thing I don't like though, the supporting cd software for filing and editing your photos would not run on my Windows XP Dell :( Not to worry: I can always buy Photo Shop :) I would recommend this camera to anyone who wants a small camera and can afford this one.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I bought this for the price, around $300+ with bag + memory card, and for the modern look. And it takes amazing pics. I needed a good affordable camera for location scouting that is compact enough to put in my pocket.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Flexible controls operates as closely to my Nikon N90S film camera, as any point and shoot camera I have tested to this date. Great pictures of my dogs at play in the yard and inside the house. Shutter mode allows fast shutter speeds to freeze the action. The camera brain sets the ISO and aperture to ensure proper exposure. Shutter response is slower than I would like. I miss shots, because I press the shutter button and the 1/2 second lag is too much. The action has left the frame.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I was looking for a new point and shoot camera and this one really caught my eye. I love the design of the camera, very vintage-like. The HD video on the camera is pretty amazing ... the sound is not as good but it's fine since the picture quality is so amazing. I'm still playing around will all the options on the camera but so far I love it. I wish it had a better zoom.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Just used it on European vacation. Awesome for evening landscape shots because of 24 mm fast lens. Only issue was the battery power meter goes from strong to zero without much warning. Also in super bright daytime the screen was a bit hard to see.Wish it had a regular viewfinder.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Small / Compact; Nice Body Color; Good Image Quality; Good in Low Light; Easy To Use; Short Lag Time; Large Clear LCD
Cons: No Viewfinder
I use this camera as a small alternative to my dslr that I can carry around everyday and record daily life. THe toggle wheel is flimsy. Short cuts are inappropriate, more likely to be changing white balance, iso on the fly than the ones offered.Build quality quite good. Battery good. Wireless image download via bluetooth or web would be good. Happy with camera though.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Not a competitor for the S95, good movie
Item.Review: This camera is priced about a hundred bucks less than the S95 and LX5, so it's not really a competitor for those bigger-sensor cameras. I bought it for the autofocus movie mode, and was not disappointed. Good well-rounded camera for those looking for reasonable snapshots and an effective movie mode. Image quality is good, no RAW was not a deal-breaker for me; that's what my DSLR is for.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I gave this camera to my fiance as a gift, and we recently took it on a trip to Turkey. Camera took lovely pictures, turns on super quickly (handy for snapping quick shots), and didn't eat batteries. One issue -- there was a USB charger included in the package, but it was not listed on the website, so we bought one from another source. Listing everything in the package would be nice.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Nikon P300 small camea - big features
Item.Review:
Pros: Good Image Quality; Large Clear LCD; Fast/accurate auto-focus; Small / Compact; Good in Low Light; Easy To Use; Good Image Stabilization; Short Lag Time
Cons: No Viewfinder; Limited Zoom
The Nikon P300 is a very useful low light small cameral. It has fantastic HD and slow motion video. Easy to use and many settings to try. The only issue is that at the longest zoom it is not as useful in low light situation. Picture quality is really outstanding in normal situation and video is good. I've taken many photos in large auditoriums and great results. Chuck

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: It amazed me with its bright and clear lens when I took some shots inside Metropolitan Museum. None of them needed flash. Quality was very good in a low ISO. Shutter speed according to a point and shoot: not that fast, neither that boring. I enjoyed very much the moment.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Good in Low Light; Nice Body Color
Cons: Poor Image Stabilization; Limited Zoom
I bought this camera for my friend. He said it is good because it is not heavy and easy to carry and takes good enough photos to print.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Cons: The instructions for and operation of the camera are too complicated for me.
Pictures have a blue tint. Software is uncooperative. No provision for transferring pictures to a CD.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: No pro, but I love this camera!
Item.Review: I really wanted to get a camera that can take good pictures in low light, since I end up taking a lot of shots out at bars/restaurants with my friends, and at concerts. I also wanted something a step above the more disposable/low quality point and shoots, so that it'll be a long time before I need (or want) to buy a new camera. I'm no professional photographer (there's a lot of debate among pros about which high end point and shoot is the best), but this camera absolutely rocks. It's easy to use and 99% of the time the pictures I take with the auto settings are absolutely amazing. It takes fantastic pictures in low light, and when I do manually fiddle with the settings (something I keep planning on learning how to do better, though I, er, still haven't quite gotten around to it...), things ... still turn out great. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Fast, great image quality and features, but less than 6 months, the on/off button doesn't work. It started acting up after just a few months, but now dead in the water. It is a shame becuz this is a super camera..it just needs to be reliable.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Were it not for the lack of RAW recording and rather short (4.2x) zoom, this would be my go-to camera. It would also be nice if you could bump the ISO to 6400. Bought this specifically for a trip to SE Asia because I didn't want to lug a DSLR with me (already carrying a TLR) and it hasn't disappointed. Carry it day-to-day at work as a bike messenger and it's got a lot of punch for a small camera. Super-fast continuous shooting, coupled with the wide angle and large aperture make for a great camera to shoot from the hip with; great in crowded old markets where you want to be discreet. All in all, very satisfied but wish I knew how to hack to firmware to unlock RAW. Almost forgot, the panorama feature is awesome!

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: the lack of an orientation sensor was annoying but in the end i returned the camera due to the inability to reduce the aggressive JPEG compression. to illustrate, at 9MP the photo file sizes were 1/3 smaller than produced by my 6MP camera on fine mode. also, the auto-focus at f1.8/widest frame was picky. aside from that it was well made and had a great set of features and was very fast.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Good camera, shoots well under low light
Item.Review: I like its ability to shoot good pictures under low light conditions. The LCD has high resolution and shows good details when you check the pictures you just shot. I've only used it for a couple of weeks, but the battery capacity may be on the low side. It doesn't last for one full day.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Great Zoom; Nice Body Color; Good Image Stabilization; Easy To Use; Fast/accurate auto-focus; Good in Low Light; Large Clear LCD; Good Image Quality; Small / Compact; Short Lag Time
Easy to change speed, fstop etc. Very quick. Good storage for high density pics. Would like better battery life. It is ok but other point and shoots I have can shoot 800 pics before recharge.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Awesome Camera! Great for Low light & many extras!
Item.Review:
Pros: Great for family pictures & low light
Cons: None
Unfortunately, My Nikon P50 broke which gave me a reason to up-grade and purchase a new camera. I was deciding between the Nikon P300 & the D3000. I wasn't sure if I wanted to take the leap to carry around a big camera, so after some web-researching, and many consumer reports reviews rated the P300 camera with very high remarks I decided to purchase it. So off I went to Bestbuy - but to my surprise they did not carry this model in-store. The sales man directed me to the department in which I can order the camera (online and shipped to my home). I was a bit hesitant in purchasing the camera with out seeing it and was totally bummed I would have to wait for it to be shipped to my home. a few days later my Nikon P300 ... arrived and it is AWESOME. The functionality of this camera is comparable to my previous Nikon. I started shooting the kids inside and outside and decided to try out the low-light advantage. Let me tell you... I went into my closet, closed the door, and snapped away. I couldn't believe I got a beautiful shot of my favorite coat in the dark. The Scene selection is very cool as well. Ranging from a night firework shot to a snow shot. The screen is phenomenal as well...I will be taking many more pictures and HD videos with this incredible great deal I got on sale at Bestbuy! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: The main advantage - the video, the main drawback - the mediocre quality of the camera for this photo. For the money could have better pictures! I have a Nikon L14 and his or her photo displayed fine details more clearly than the Nikon P300! Although, it is necessary to pay tribute - in the evening P300 fotkat a head taller than the L14, plus manual settings ... On auto mode fotkat not be better to use semi-automatic (P).

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Nikon Coolpix P300 for low light
Item.Review: I bought Nikon Coolpix P300 from B&H photo. The camera order processing as well as shipping was on time. I am an extensive traveler and take 100s of pictures during each of our vacations. This camera is compact, light weight, simple to use, takes great pictures. The night pictures, however, were not as good as I got by using my panasonic digital camera. Close up pictures were better with this camera as compared to that by panasonic digital camera. I am yet to try some of the complex features of this camera.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Low light pictures, sturdy metal case.
Cons: Selection wheel seems a little flimsy.
Bought this camera for good low light photography. This camera produces amazing low light pictures. Still findin out about all of the features.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Great camera for on the go. Has an excellent set of features and takes quality photos. The design of the camera itself is also appealing. It reminds me of an old-fashioned camera with its boxiness. Great buy!

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Review extensively before plunging in to buy P300, at the deep discount price of[$] Just want (note, not need) an update of my trustful P50 which is a bit long on the tooth. Have taken great images and videos with P300. Not shooting RAW so not a pixel peeper. Mostly shoot in 5mp to save memory space and plenty for regular photos.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I was looking for a small compact camera as a lighter and smaller alternative to my DSLR. Many people place this camera in the same category as the Canon S95, however it lacks some more advanced features. This camera does not shoot in RAW, a major drawback. Also the controls dials and knobs feel a bit low quality and loose. It touts an f1.8 lens, but this is only at it's widest 24mm lens setting, otherwise it quickly jumps to f4.9. This would be a good camera for an amateur who is not often interesting in having the RAW capability to to edit photos, but not up par for those who want DSLR function in a compact size.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I am by no means a professional photographer. I primarily use my point and shoot to capture the moment. I wanted a camera that was very easy to use and took nice, crisp pictures. This is my first non-Canon digital camera. I switched from Canons because the newer models have not gotten great reviews. I have had this camera for just over a month now and I can't say I'm totally happy with it. Many pictures turn out blurry. It's definitely sluggish compared to my older Canon camera. Overall picture and colour quality just isn't the same. And it also has some issues when downloading pics to my Mac. I have to open Image Capture before the Nikon software or any other software (Picasa, iPhoto) will acknowledge the photos on the camera. It's not a terrible camera but I think there's gotta b ... e better ones out there. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: This is an amazing camera! It is a bit on the pricier side of point-and-shoots for these days but that is because it comes with a whole host of manual features including manual aperture! It is very easy to use and takes incredibly crisp daytime and low-light/night photos!

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: As a casual photographer you can t go wrong with this camera. The wide lens makes my photos appear to have a professional appearance and I am amazed at the macro shots that I have taken. I decided to purchase this camera after comparing it with the Canon and Panasonic competitors.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: The camera is bigger than I expected - a bit uncomfortable to put in a pocket - but takes GREAT photos. Night shots come out amazing, and the video quality is awesome as well.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I bought 2 of these cameras for a high school yearbook staff. We also use a D300 and a d7000. If it were not for low light sport shooting, we would ditch the DSLR's thanks to these cameras. When the students use the camera wide open they get amazing results with no flash. Everything you would expect from a 1.8 lens. The large display is excellent for reviewing shots.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Feels as precious as the pictures...
Item.Review: Image quality for both still shots and videos are amazing and have met my expactactions. However, the build quality reminds you that you spent less than $300... Even though Nikon does not include a protective camera case, I believe B&H should have.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Review: Nikon Coolpix P300 Digital Camera - Black (12MP CMOS, 4.2 x Optical Zoom) 3 inch LCD
Item.Review:
Good Points: Brilliant Optics (4.2x zoom rather than silly 10x or 15x)
True pocket size but with most of the setting features of the D5000 such as spot metering or zone focusing.
Full manual controls available with built-in "lightmeter". Also Aperture or Speed priority modes and many other effects in addition to point-and-shoot if you want it.
HD movies of stunning quality - lovely for family gatherings.
Makes other people want one usually.
Bad Points: Some features like spot metering not available in point-and-shoot mode.
Advanced user manual in the CD only

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Very Pleased with this Little Camera!
Item.Review: I am a semi-pro photographer so I own a very nice Nikon dSLR with some professional lenses, so I know how to take a nice image. However, on a recent trip to Disneyland, I didn't want to lug that expensive and heavy equipment. So I picked up the Coolpix P300 instead...and I love it! Normally my biggest frustration with point-and-shoots is that they won't let me do what I know I could do with my big camera -- I usually feel so limited. But NOT with this one! The low-light capabilities rock, the wide angle is incredibly useful, and I LOVE how the flash doesn't always kick on (you have to pop it up first...) Very easy to use and figure out, and very intuitive. In short, this little camera is FUN to use, produces some great images, and I am very pleased with it. Some technical aspects: this ... camera has an amazing lack of shutterlag for a compact, very pleased about that. Also, it has a really fun smile timer, so you can point it at a child, and say don't smile!! and the second they actually DO, the camera takes the shot. It's amazing! Really very helpful with kids. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: The P300 does much better in low light than most point and shoots, due to the fast 1.8 f-stop lens on the wide angle end and the backlit sensor. The lens sharpness is excellent. I found it to be a great all around camera. Excellent vibration reduction system. Very happy with the results.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Larger screen, better low light pictures
We have been using the camera for a couple of months now and the pictures are great. We had an older camera and wanted better low light pictures. This one not only has a memory card but also internal memory so if you have the memory stick in your computer and forgot about it, you can still take pictures but you will need the USB cable to extract them.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Really impressed with this little dude.
Item.Review: I wanted a really handsome, compact point-and-shoot for travel and taking everyday pictures. This thing is mighty and powerful, and takes a really great-looking snapshot, according to this amateur. The battery life is super impressive, as well: I don't even remember when the last time was that I charged the camera, and yet the battery still appears to be fully charged. A++.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Good Image Stabilization; Nice Body Color; Great Zoom; Short Lag Time; Good in Low Light
THIS LITTLE GEM REALLY PACKS 'EM IN. I HAVE HEARD HOW LOUSY PICTURES THIS CAMERA TAKES....BUT ALL YA GOTTA DO IS RESET THE QUALITY. I LOVE THIS CAMERA BECAUSE OF SIZE. WHO WANTS TO LUG AROUND A CAMERA ANYMORE? THIS LITTLE GUY IS SMALLER THAN A PACK OF CIGARETTES (& WHO EVEN SMOKES ANYMORE?). IT'S SMALL,BUT DON'T DROP IT! IT'S HISTORY IF YA DO! THIS IS MY SECOND S220....TRIED THE COOLPIX W/TOUCH SCREEN. STAY AWAY FROM THOSE!!! UNLESS YA GOT A LOT OF TIME TO SCREW AROUND, AND A LOT OF PATIENCE. TOUCH SCREENS HAVE A SLOW AND USUALLY INCORRECT RESPONSE. THE BODY ON THOSE ARE A BIT LARGER TOO. AS I SAID ......THIS LITTLE CAMERA IS A GEM, AND NOT MUCH BIGGER!! ONLY PROBLEM IS, AS USUAL ..... ... IT'S BEEN DISCONTINUED. SO,GO GET 'EM!!! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I use the P300 to photograph paintings at museums when photography is allowed. It captures accurate color without a flash. The vibration reduction really works to compensate for my shaky right hand. I also get good family pictures indoors with mixed lighting from windows and a variety of light bulbs.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: This camera doesnt look fancy, nor is it the slimmest, nor does it come in 10 different colors to match your outfit. It is a black, standard looking point and shoot that does wonders. with an f 1:1.8, this camera takes far better shots than any other in low light conditions, sometimes taking better lit pictures than even your own eye is seeing. It really doesnt need its flash unless its really dark. I have a professional nikon as well with a few different lenses, and find that this point and shoot is the perfect addition to the family, to carry with me and be the closest to what a professional compact camera would be.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I could not be more pleased with this new camera. It has taken great photos in a variety of light settings. I used it last weekend at my son's wedding and all the events of the weekend. All the pictures were very clear and high quality except a few I took in extremely low light. I usually forgot to open the flash for the first few pictures and those even came out okay, but not great.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: My wife wanted to collect images of wildflowers,especially those in the desert areas. The macro feature on this camera is superb. She finds it easy to use as an all purpose camera as well.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Takes great pictures and easy to use
Item.Review: We use this at our Auto Recycling business for vehicle photos and works great for the indoor pictures and can also turn out great pictures of the interior where the lighting is not very good. Easy to use and would purchase again. Great to find a F1.8 lens on a point and shoot camera.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I mainly use it for its video ability to creat videos for web reports, specifically the HD quality, 60fps, and 120fps recording rate make this camera a powerful light wieght tool that doesn't brake the bank. Image quality is acceptable especially considering the low price and portability.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: After considerable research for a pocket-size camera, I followed the recommendation of Consumers Reports and purchased the Nikon Coolpix P300. I am completely satisfied with the camera and recommend it to anyone. I initially had a problem finding one in Detroit Metropolitan Area Best Buy and other stores. Fortunately, I purchased one from B&H Photo for a better price than [...]

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I recently dropped my dslr due to size and hassle issues (like getting it into clubs or events). I was very concerned about using a P&S because I had gotten so used to the flexibility of having a dedicated flash, and large(ish) aperture lens. I was pleasantly surprised with this camera. It did take me a while to discover where everything was and while my shots are not as good as using a dslr, they're dang good enough that my friends are still asking me how I did it. The flash is still quite small, and definitely does not have the reach of a dedicated flash unit (i used the 430 ex II), so dont expect to be able to light up anything more than a few feet away. The camera also feels like it will not survive much abuse, although I do not want to test out this theory. Audio quality i ... s great and I do not get significant noise at high volumes, although some clipping does occur. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: This Nikon P300 is a remarkable camera that shoots exceptionally well. The pics quality on this camera is superb and very similiar to the ones I'm taking with my Nikon D200. This camera is indeed fast and shoots extremely well in low light as advertised. Video is amazing on this camera too. I shoot video on this at 720p and am amazed! I would definitely recommend this camera to anyone looking for a quality point and shoot on the high end!

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Comfortable Controls; Bright LCD; Easy Setup; Easy To Use
My last camera was a good, but old analog one. I am amazed and delighted by what my new digital camera can do. I've only had it for a few weeks, but can already tell how much fun I'm going to have with it.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I use this product for amateur video filming and taking photos of some attractions. Good quality video, great pictures in good light. Weak detail photos with non-ideal conditions, very poor zoom

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I bought this camera to learn more about photography, while still having the convenience of a point and shoot. This camera does just that, and the picture quality is great.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Large Clear LCD; Good Image Stabilization; Fast/accurate auto-focus; Good in Low Light; Good Image Quality; Easy To Use; Small / Compact
Terrific camera for the price. Very sharp pictures. Great for travel

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I was at first a little sketchy to buy it, and i worried because one review said it didnt contain the RAW feature, however i am more than satisfied with how sharp and clear the pictures are! also at how well it takes pictures (in many different light conditions etc.) and the speed at which it takes them is all wonderful. This camera is sooooo much more than one would expect, Nikon has really done an amazing job, i STRONGLY recommend it to all!

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I like that the screen protector is hard. I can never put on the sticker ones without getting bubbles. When the sunshade is down it also gives it more protection. It sticks on easily and the shade comes on and off without any trouble.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I researched a number of cameras and found the Coolpix 300 met my needs. I have just received it and hven't used it much but I do like the size and simplicity of it. I especially like the range of the zoom which I lacked in my old camera. The only complaint I have is the size of the camera pouch. It could be a little bigger. Trying to get anything in and out of the zippered pocket is almost impossible.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Very pleased--other reviews are in line.
Item.Review: I use this camera to take photos at weddings I officiate and post on my Raleigh Wedding Blog. Actually my assistant uses the camera. She finds it easy to use and it is truly wonderful in low light venues. I am absolutely amazed!

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Large Clear LCD; Excellent wide angle view; Good Image Stabilization; Good Image Quality; Fast/accurate auto-focus; Good in Low Light
This is an easy to use point-and-shoot that yeilds excellent still photos. The HD video is also excellent.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Bought this subcompact for a trip to Hawaii. My husband is a professional photographer and even he was impressed with the quality of the pics and the abilities of the amera.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: only thing missing is the raw format
Item.Review: this is the perfect camera for me to carry anywhere anytime with a dslr feature and a very sharp low light picture but the depth of field in f1.8 is not at all good i can't get a good bookeh but i have a d700 & d90 so i don't mind at all. i like the overall features in scene mode specially the panorama the only thing i find missing is the raw otherwise its a good camera no doubt

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I use this camera fir casual pictures. The pictures are very sharp, but the auto setting does not do well in fluorescent lighting Better to use the pre sets for lighting other than flash or sunlight.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: A lot of camera in a small package
Item.Review: The speed and the quality of this camera is surprising. Good things really come in small packages. I use this mostly indoor without a flash and it does a pretty fair job.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: I would highly recommend this camera
Item.Review: I needed a camera to take photos of property. The salesman helped me find what was right for me since I am not tech savvy. I needed a quality camera that was simple to use and reasonably priced.[...]

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Wonderful and sort of old school flash!
Item.Review: My main problem is manually raising the flash, which I don't enjoy when I'm in a hurry to take a photo. I use this during my travels to capture family vacation moments and it's easy to use and on the go! Sometimes when taking photos, the main objects are crisp and clear, but the background is totally blurred by a person's single movement.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: The P300 does what a good P&S camera should do. It has excellent basic features for the everyday shooter, plus enough additional manual controls to satisfy the needs of a beginner who wants to advance his skills. My advice is to print the CD instruction manual and study it to get full use out of this versatile camera.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: This is a very well designed, high quality, compact camera. It has its user interface quirks, but so do they all, and you get used to it. I have other cameras, but this is the one I plan to carry around all the time.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I bought this housing a week ago and right now I am in the process of getting familiar with it before heading underwater. In handling this housing, I realized that the construction was outstanding. Made in USA is proudly indicated on the unit. All the knobs and levers are high quality along with the body.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Dont judge a book by its cover
Item.Review: You have to manually open the flash every time you wanna use it. It has a lot white dots when shooting at dark colors (mainly black), its more visible when you use the zoom

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: I would not recommend this camera.
Item.Review:
Pros: Lightweight
Cons: Bad picture quality
Oh! It looks beautiful only in a showcase.
Makes lot of noise and pictures taken at max resolution are not at all appealing. Feels like you have taken a snap with 6 or 8 Megapixel camera.
When the lens adjust automatically, it makes lot of noise as if something is jammed inside. May be it was faulty. Deeply disappointed by this Nikon S220.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy To Use; Easy Setup
Cons: Bad previews on the LCD; Short Battery Life
I found that the actual pictures are fine, but the previews on the LCD are terrible. There is often gross distortion in the colors of the LCD preview. There is something wrong with the processing algorithms inside this camera.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:

Highly recommended!

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Best item I didn t know I needed! Easy to install, and it seems like it will be something people will ask me, Where did you get that? There seems to be an indication of a lever of some sort on the bottom of it, but doesn t work that way, to my knowledge--you just pull up the center and the sides pop out.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Got this camera to do digiscoping with my Nikon 82mm ED spotting scope. One of the best compact digital camera for digiscoping because it is fast and also big aperture F/1.8.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: easy to use, excellent low light cmos, auto white balance is spot on, compact and easy to carry around, 1080P video is great (if you need more zoom get a bigger camera this ones not for you)

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: excellent camera for a reasonable price
Item.Review: I had never owned Nikon before. After I received this camera, I experimented with few features such HD movie clips, aperture priority etc and am pleased to see the results.The camera is small enough that it fits in your pocket yet it is powerful that it takes professional photos.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I Don't Need No Stinking Flash,the Coolpix P300 is as only Nikon could produce. The capabilities of this camera are endless, easy to operate in ALL SITUATIONS, period.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: If you are scared to pay this amount for the small camera, Don't be ~ You pay for what you get, the weight is just right, takes great pictures at night as well as day time. I bought it for a vacation. Worked GREAT. Don't be cheap. Buy one.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P300 12.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: This camera is very easy to use in the auto mode...perfect for point and shoot, But also incorporates all of the features and modes to control every aspect of picture taking from the shutter speed, aperature value, iso sensitivity..etc. I am definitely an amateur photographer but wanted a camera that would take exceptional pictures and gave me the opportunity to learn and discover the art of picture taking... And the Nikon Coolpix p300 does just that!!!
